content:
For an independent set I and an element e âˆˆ M.closure I \ I, the matroid M has a unique circuit contained in insert e I, called the fundamental circuit of e and I. The most common use case is where I is a base.

This circuit's existence allows us to prove that every dependent set contains a circuit, and that two matroids with the same circuits are equal.

The diff is under 150 lines.
